data: Funerary inscription to Olos Papios Agatharchos
Rectangular plaque of grey stone. Left and right edges square and complete. Top right corner broken. Large protrusion on rear face.
Three lines of Greek text. Text is not aligned with centre of stone, with a more significant vacat on right side of the stone than the left. End of line 1 obscured by damaged top right corner.
Some serifs are used, particularly on the epsilons. Spacing, especially in line 1, is irregular. Teardrop shaped omega in line 1. All alphas have a broken mid-bar.

The place, date, and circumstances of the discovery are unknown. While the piece is assumed to have come from Termini Imerese, the antiquarian tradition records the transport of the inscription to and from Rome. Korhonen (2001, 100) suggests that this narrative is incorrect.
Antoniou, 2022-07-06. On display in Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions
Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus

G. Kaibel, Inscriptiones Graecae Siciliae et Italiae, additis graecis Galliae Hispaniae, Britanniae, Germaniae inscriptionibus, Inscriptiones Graecae consilio et auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editae. Volumen XIV., XIV (Berlin: Georgius Reimerus, 1890)
Iscrizione greche del museo civico di Termini Imerese
Antonietta Brugnone, «Iscrizione greche del museo civico di Termini Imerese», Kokalos 20 (1974): 218–64
Kalle Korhonen, «Osservazioni sul collezionismo epigrafico siciliano», Arctos: acta philologica fennica 35 (2001): 85–102
Korhonen, 2001, Osservazioni sul collezionismo epigrafico siciliano
funerary inscription to olos papios agatharchos
ISic001150. Funerary inscription to Olos Papios Agatharchos

1Ὦλε Πάπ̣ιε
2Ἀγάθαρχε
3χαῖρε

Ὦλε Πάπιε Ἀγάθαρχε χαῖρε

1ΩΛΕΠΑ.ΙΕ
2ΑΓΑΘΑΡΧΕ
3ΧΑΙΡΕ

ΩΛΕΠΑΠΙΕΑΓΑΘΑΡΧΕΧΑΙΡΕ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy ;
  • 1: The damage to the top right of line 1, might be reconstructed as pi, or tau (with a short crossbar) followed by another letter (perhaps iota). That the final two letters were iota and epsilon is recorded in IG as extant on the stone.

English translation

Alex Antoniou

Olos Papios Agatharchos, farewell.

commentary

The praenomen Olos, derived from the Latin Aulus, is attested elsewhere epigraphically (but not in Sicily). If the restoration is correct, Papios is the first epigraphic instance of the transcription of Papius into Greek. Agatharcos is a common Greek name. Korhonen notes that this inscription was never transported and sent back from Rome, as recorded in IG (with bibliography).
